alert.note: Alert for Cascade County below 5000ft; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 11:07AM MST until January 18 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches possible. * WHERE...Eastern Toole and Liberty Counties, Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton Counties, Western and Central Chouteau County, Cascade County below 5000ft, and Judith Basin County and Judith Gap. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
